content.description: Obvious incut rails.Â  Topout to the left and don't fall in the water.
content.location: Right side of the pool above the falls. Water under start during when the falls are flowing.

content.description: This route is to the immediate left of thing one. 25 foot fist crack/ow depending on hand size.
content.location: This route is not part of the falls at all, but is actually located about ten minutes down the creek, on the right. Look closely, there is a small tree in front of it that sometimes makes it hard to see

This route is not part of the falls at all, but is actually located about ten minutes down the creek, on the right.  Look closely, there is a small tree in front of it that sometimes makes it hard to see.

content.description: Follow good crack at the start of fingers route up about 15 feet until you see the flake off to the right. Traverse right to the flake (crux 1), then go straight up from there following the "soft" arete all the way up the the large ledge that "polished" and "horn" also lead up to. From here, *don't* take the obvious line up the chunky offwidth. Start at the base of the crack and work left/up until you can top out at the top of the arete (crux 2).
content.location: Right in-between Fingers and Polished. See topo...

content.description: A few moves up a crack to a sloped ledge. From the ledge, pull over a small lip to the top.
This route is easily seen from the hike in. Thirty feet of tight fingers and tips. The crux (for me) is the last few face moves to top out.
content.protection: Pro thin. Three bolts on top.
content.location: You can get to this route via the same trail that takes you to the top of the falls, just continue walking.

content.description: Tough crux between first and second bolt. If you can get to the second bolt you are home free. Small crimpers the rest of the way. The rest of the routes is a mid 5.10.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 3 bolts/anchors at the top.
content.location: Route is located on the face of long oval boulder sitting at the top of Ortega falls.

content.description: This is the next route to the right of "fingers".  The start is the crux, a very polished, very shallow, flaring crack. Past the first ten feet the climbing eases to 5.8 with good protection.
Climb up an awkward wide crack eventually narrowing to hand/finger size
content.protection: Wide gear (+5) necessary if protecting the start is desired. If not, pro -2"
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Splitter. A pair of broken glasses mark the beginning of the climb.

content.description: Starts on the face left of Dihedral and stays left of Dihedral. Used the same bolts as Dihedral but may have a little swing near the top.

This is the route to the immediate right of "polished".  10' of easy face climbing gets you to a ledge where you can choose between two variations. Option 1- Continue straight up into the dihedral, and top out via the small horn (10a). Option 2- From the small ledge head right to the tips crack and follow up (10c/d).
This is the finger crack just to the right of the dihedral.
content.protection: It can be led but most people just top rope.
content.location: This is the obvious finger crack to the immediate right of the gully.

content.description: This is the obvious crack on the right side of the falls. Twenty feet of crack climbing gives way to ledges.
This is the obvious gully on the left side of the main face at the falls you cant miss it.
content.protection: This climb can be led but most people just top rope.  There are three bolts and a rock tunnel that make for great top rope anchors
content.location: After arriving at the base of the falls this is the obvious gully on the far left.  you cant miss it
